attributes.action: Stricter regulations for concert ticket re-sale prices.
attributes.additional_details:
Ed Sheeran fans are furious as tickets offered for up to £1,000 each... minutes after going on sale:
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/whats-on/ed-sheeran-tickets-resale-anger-12546286.amp?client=safari

Theatres struggle with ticket resale at inflated prices:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-25849543
attributes.background: Many tickets for concerts and shows will be bought in bulk as soon as they are available, to then be re-sold on partner sites at a grossly inflated cost. There needs to be limits/restrictions in place to prevent the ridiculously inflated re-sale prices of tickets.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do to restrict the reselling of tickets.

You may wish to sign this petition instead:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/177071
